title: Why is Ukraine's counteroffensive failing?
summary: In an interview with The Economist, Valeriy Zaluzhny, the commander-in-chief of Ukraine's army, claims that his country has reached a 'stalemate.'

title: Javier Milei warns economy will 'worsen' in Argentina
summary: On Sunday morning, Milei was sworn in inside the National Congress building, and outgoing President Alberto Fernández placed the presidential sash upon him.

title: Besieged once again, Gaza's health system is in agony
summary: Once again bombarded since the end of the truce on December 1, hospitals are unable to accommodate the thousands of Gazans in need of emergency care.

title: Mohamed Bazoum, the unyielding captive of Niger's junta
summary: The head of state, overthrown by a putsch in July, refuses to resign. He has been detained in Niamey for over four months, along with his wife and their son.

title: The trauma of Israeli Arab women freed in exchanges with Hamas
summary: 15 women, arrested after the October 7 attacks for expressing themselves on social media, have been exchanged for hostages held by Hamas, without having asked to be. This association with the Islamist movement could harm them in Israel.

title: Netflix's black Hannibal sparks controversy in Tunisia
summary: The choice of African-American actor Denzel Washington to portray the famous Carthaginian general has set social media abuzz, and is now being debated in Parliament.

title: COP28 pledges meet only 30% of needed energy emission cuts, says IEA
summary: While the pledges are positive steps forward, they are not enough to reach international climate targets, according to the IEA's report.

title: Egypt's upcoming election is tailor-made for el-Sissi
summary: The incumbent president is expected to be re-elected for a third six-year term following the December 10-12 vote.

title: Covid-19 soars in France as Christmas nears
summary: The rise in infections coincides with the very rapid spread of the JN.1 variant, although the new strain does not appear more likely to cause severe forms of the disease.

title: UPenn president resigns after anti-Semitism testimony backlash
summary: Elizabeth Magill 'voluntarily tendered her resignation' after scathing criticism against her and other university leaders.

title: The best Yule logs of 2023 to test across France
summary: From classic chocolate and hazelnuts to exotic mango and lime, kirsch or speculoos, these 15 desserts provide a variety of tastes (and colors) to satisfy your cravings!

title: COP28: Fossil fuel taxation at the heart of the battle to finance climate transition
summary: In preparation for COP30 in 2025, an international taskforce launched in June is to work on ways of getting the biggest greenhouse gas emitters to contribute.

title: US State Department bypasses Congress and approves sale of ammunition to Israel
summary: The Biden administration on Saturday OKed the sale of nearly 14,000 rounds of tank ammunition to Israel. The emergency provision invoked is rare, but not unprecedented.

title: Geert Wilders and his disruptive haircut won the Dutch election. Does anyone care?
summary: The far-right scored a surprise victory in the Dutch parliamentary elections on November 22. A perfect opportunity to get to know its triumphant leader, Geert Wilders, once again.

title: The strategic patience of 'Greater Israel' ideologists
summary: These ideologists are betting on the long term to impose their colonial ideas. A minority of them advocate for a return to Gaza.

title: France detains 80 in largest child sex crime swoop
summary: The men arrested come from a wide range of backgrounds, they include a local councilor and two schoolteachers.

title: Dispute brews over auction of Asterix and Cleopatra cover
summary: Sylvie Uderzo, Albert Uderzo's daughter and beneficiary, disputes the provenance of the work, estimated at between €400,000 and €500,000, and described as a 'gift' to one of her father's friends.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Isolated United States rejects UN's call for 'immediate ceasefire'
summary: With their veto in the Security Council, the Americans have buried the fifth resolution since the start of the war.

title: Netanyahu calls on Hamas militants to 'surrender now'
summary: Israel's Prime Minister claims dozens of Hamas members have surrendered in recent days.

title: Azerbaijan and Armenia promise 'concrete measures' to normalize relations
summary: The two enemy countries have shown goodwill – a remarkable breakthrough. Caution is still key though, given the fragility of the peace process.

title: Penpa Tsering, chairman of the Tibetan government-in-exile: 'The West fed the Chinese dragon'
summary: Visiting Paris, the most senior representative of the 130,000 Tibetans in the diaspora confirms that there are still 'channels of communication' with Beijing but deplores the fact that 'there is no dialogue at all.'

title: Original Asterix cover fails to find buyer after legal challenge
summary: The daughter of Albert Uderzo claims the artwork was stolen. A complaint was filed last month but Belgian prosecutors found no grounds to suspect a crime had been committed.

title: Hyperinflation wave recedes in Europe, leaving household budgets in tatters
summary: Eurozone inflation has finally dropped to 2.4% in November. However, its effects over the last two years have slashed living standards, in an unprecedented decline since the 1970s, leading to major changes in consumer habits.

title: COP climate talks focus on fossil fuel deal
summary: Climate campaigners and negotiators say the world has never been this close to a deal on winding down oil, gas and coal.

title: Trump says he won't testify in New York fraud trial
summary: In a statement, the former president said he has 'nothing more to say'.

title: Slovaki's Robert Fico is taking control of justice since his return to power
summary: Slovakia's new prime minister, who has been hit with corruption investigations, has launched wide-ranging purges among magistrates and police officers.

title: Who are the Yemeni Houthis involved in the war between Hamas and Israel?
summary: After firing drones and missiles, and capturing a ship belonging to an Israeli businessman, Houthi rebels have attacked two ships in the Red Sea. These actions illustrate their ability to cause harm, but above all their regional ambitions.

title: Narges Mohammadi: 'Our cause is more about survival than the improvement of our quality of life'
summary: A leading figure of the 'Women, Life and Liberty movement, the activist and journalist, incarcerated in Tehran, will begin a new hunger strike on Sunday, as she is to be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in Stockholm. Her speech, published by Le Monde, will be delivered by her two children, Kiana and Ali Rahmani.

title: Male mosquitoes used to bite, too – around 145 million years ago
summary: By studying two male fossils in amber from the early Cretaceous, a team of Lebanese and Chinese researchers found that these specimens were hematophagous, whereas only females are today.

title: Serbian elections set to challenge or confirm president's hold on power
summary: On Sunday, December 17, Serbians will head to the polls, in local and parliamentary elections which will serve as a referendum on President Aleksandar Vucic's government, which has been challenged by shootings, protests and tensions with Kosovo.

title: India's supreme court upholds Kashmir autonomy revocation
summary: The court ruled to uphold a 2019 decision to revoke the limited autonomy which had been in force since the 1950's in the Muslim-majority state, where an insurgency has raged for decades. India's President Modi welcomed the decision as a 'beacon of hope.'

title: Philippines summons Chinese diplomats over clashes at sea
summary: China's envoy and ambassador have been summoned by the Philippines, with expelling them 'seriously considered', after several confrontations between Chinese and Philippine boats over the weekend in the disputed South China Sea.

title: COP28: China proves a key player in possible fossil fuel phase-out
summary: During the negotiations, China's climate envoy did not rule out the idea of a gradual phase-out of fossil fuels.

title: Javier Milei warns of painful austerity measures as he takes office in Argentina
summary: The country's new president was sworn in on Sunday. In his inaugural address, he warned of a painful period of unemployment, economic stagnation and inflation.

title: Israel justifies arrests of Palestinians after images showing stripped men detained in Gaza
summary: Israel responded to the fierce criticism provoked by degrading photographs and videos showing dozens of naked men, some of them blindfolded, captured by the Israeli army on December 7.

title: Doctors in one Paris suburb fear a potential health crisis if State Medical Aid gets abolished
summary: As the Assemblée Nationale will start debating an immigration bill on Monday, this public hospital is among those most exposed to the consequences of a potential reform of this healthcare coverage.

title: 'Danny the Red' breaks with Macron and calls on the left to unite for the European Elections
summary: Daniel Cohn-Bendit, who had supported Macron since 2017, is now criticizing the French president for having given up on a balanced stance to place 'the center-right in power.'

title: 'Leave the World Behind' review: Survival of the fittest
summary: Sam Esmail's film, streaming on Netflix, stars Julia Roberts and Ethan Hawke. Their characters plunge into an end-of-the-world scenario after a cyberattack.

title: Russia to hold presidential vote in occupied Ukraine
summary: Moscow said that it would be holding Russian presidential elections in Ukrainian regions Russia claimed to have annexed.

title: Reborn night train links Berlin and Paris
summary: The overnight connection returns nine years after the previous service was shut down. It is set to run daily from October 2024.

title: Science Po director suggests his temporary suspension after arrest for domestic violence
summary: Around 100 students staged a sit-in to call for Mathias Vicherat's resignation. Him and his wife were arrested on December 3 after accusations of domestic violence.

title: New Tintin edition addresses racism controversy
summary: The new edition of 'Tintin in the Congo' contains a preface explaining the colonial context of the time it was released, in 1931. It had become increasingly criticized for the way it portrayed Africans.

title: Golden Globes: Barbenheimer tops 2024 nominations
summary: 'Barbie' and 'Oppenheimer' topped the newly revamped Golden Globes film nominations Monday, with Greta Gerwig's feminist satire receiving nine nominations, and Christopher Nolan's drama eight.

title: Olympic surfing to be held in Teahupo'o after solution found to row, Polynesia president says
summary: Moetai Brotherson said an agreement had been found with environmental organizations to allow the contest to be held at the famous wave.

title: Elon Musk reinstates far-right conspiracy theorist Alex Jones on X
summary: Following a poll Musk conducted on X, the billionaire owner of the social media platform went back on his decision not to let the far-right conspiracy theorist back on ex-Twitter.

title: French government faces major test as immigration bill arrives on the floor of the Assemblée Nationale
summary: As the government has lost its majority after the 2022 legislative elections, Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin is not guaranteed to have the votes to pass his text.

title: Russia's repression machine goes into overdrive
summary: Condemned to heavy sentences, ordinary citizens opposed to the war in Ukraine are joining the list of political prisoners by the dozens.

title: Polish parliament rejects proposed right-wing government
summary: The national conservatives who have ruled Poland for eight years are expected to finally relinquish power this week to a centrist bloc led by political veteran Donald Tusk.

title: French lower house rejects Macron's immigration bill
summary: The rejection of the controversial bill is a blow for Macron's centrist government, and has fuelled speculation that it could opt to trigger the extremely unpopular article 49.3 of the constitution, which allows it to pass legislation without a vote

title: Critics pan 'unacceptable' draft text as COP28 comes to an end
summary: The UN climate conference's deal has been criticized for ignoring calls to phase out fossil fuels, with activists fearing objections from fossil fuel-producing countries have had an impact.

title: 'The end of the line': The French repatriation center helping migrants who choose to go home
summary: People volunteering to leave France will spend their last days in the country at a new center opened in September near Toulouse, where they receive administrative and financial support.

title: French MPs reject Macron's immigration bill without debating it
summary: The rejection of the controversial bill is a major blow for Macron's government. Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin offered to resign but the president refused to accept his resignation.

title: 'The Argentine society of the early 20th century hailed by Javier Milei was far from idyllic'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, historian Ezequiel Adamovsky counters the claims of Argentina's new president, arguing that the liberal policies put in place by the 1976 dictatorship are to blame for the country's plunge into poverty.

title: The lost Gaza of a young Palestinian refugee in France
summary: 'Nacera' – who is French-Palestinian – was exfiltrated from Gaza at the beginning of November with her parents, and now watches helplessly as the city where she was born and grew up is destroyed.

title: Poland: Donald Tusk appointed prime minister
summary: The Polish parliament on Monday appointed the centrist leader to form the next government, paving the way for a new pro-European Union administration following eight years of turbulent national conservative rule.

title: Zelensky warns US Congress that delay in military aid is fulfilling Putin's 'dreams'
summary: The Ukrainian leader in a speech in Washington on Monday issued a plea to Republicans in Congress to break its deadlock and approve continued support for Kyiv. He is set to meet with President Joe Biden and congressional leaders from both parties on Tuesday.
